revised_title: Investigation of Luminous Glow in Exhausted Receivers and the Effect of Magnetic Fields
tldr: The author investigates the generation of a luminous glow in exhausted receivers when moving near an electrostatic field and examines the effect of a magnetic field on the glow. The experiments show that the glow's intensity varies with the velocity of rotation, and its position changes with the direction of rotation. The glow is also affected by a magnetic field, with the direction and intensity of the glow reversing when the magnetic pole or rotation direction is changed.
